data.chText: 崎岖不平的小路
data.enText: rough path

data.chText: （人踩出的）小道，小径
data.enText: a rough path or road, usually one that has not been built but that has been made by people walking there

data.chText: 穿过森林的泥泞小径
data.enText: a muddy track through the forest

data.chText: 地面上的痕迹
data.enText: marks on ground

data.chText: （人、动物或车辆留下的）足迹，踪迹；车辙
data.enText: marks left by a person, an animal or a moving vehicle

data.chText: 我们跟着熊在雪地上留下的足迹走。
data.enText: We followed the bear's tracks in the snow.

data.chText: 轮胎印迹
data.enText: tyre tracks

data.chText: 火车
data.enText: for train

data.chText: 轨道
data.enText: rails that a train moves along

data.chText: 铁路轨道
data.enText: railway/railroad tracks

data.chText: 印度有数千英里的铁道。
data.enText: India has thousands of miles of track.

data.chText: （火车站的）站台
data.enText: a track with a number at a train station that a train arrives at or leaves from

data.chText: 开往芝加哥的列车停靠在9号站台。
data.enText: The train for Chicago is on track 9.

data.chText: 赛跑
data.enText: for races

data.chText: （赛跑、赛车等的）跑道
data.enText: a piece of ground with a special surface for people, cars, etc. to have races on

data.chText: 赛跑跑道
data.enText: a running track

data.chText: 一级方程式大奖赛赛道
data.enText: a Formula One Grand Prix track (= for motor racing)

data.chText: 方向；路线
data.enText: direction/course

data.chText: （移动的）路径，路线，方向
data.enText: the path or direction that sb/sth is moving in

data.chText: 警察正在追踪窃贼。
data.enText: Police are on the track of (= searching for) the thieves.

data.chText: 她现在升迁在望。
data.enText: She is on the fast track to promotion (= will get it quickly) .

data.chText: 录音磁带；光盘
data.enText: on tape/CD

data.chText: （唱片、录音磁带或光盘的）一首乐曲，一首歌曲
data.enText: a piece of music or song on a record, tape or CD

data.chText: 他们最新唱片专辑里的一首歌曲
data.enText: a track from their latest album

data.chText: （录音磁带或计算机磁盘的）音轨，声道
data.enText: part of a tape or computer disk that music or information can be recorded on

data.chText: 十六声道录音室
data.enText: a sixteen track recording studio

data.chText: 她是唱和声的。
data.enText: She sang on the backing track.

data.chText: 幕帘
data.enText: for curtain

data.chText: （幕帘的）滑轨，滑道
data.enText: a pole or rail that a curtain moves along

data.chText: 大型车辆
data.enText: on large vehicle

data.chText: （推土机等的）履带
data.enText: a continuous belt of metal plates around the wheels of a large vehicle such as a bulldozer that allows it to move over the ground
back on track

data.chText: 重新步入正确轨道；恢复正常
data.enText: going in the right direction again after a mistake, failure, etc.

data.chText: 离婚之后我力图使生活恢复正常。
data.enText: I tried to get my life back on track after my divorce.
be on track

data.chText: 稳步前进；做法对头
data.enText: to be doing the right thing in order to achieve a particular result

data.chText: 柯蒂斯正踏上夺取金牌之途。
data.enText: Curtis is on track for the gold medal.
keep/lose track of sb/sth

data.chText: 了解 / 不了解…的动态；与…保持 / 失去联系
data.enText: to have/not have information about what is happening or where sb/sth is

data.chText: 银行账单有助于你了解你的资金使用情况。
data.enText: Bank statements help you keep track of where your money is going.

data.chText: 我一点儿也说不准现在是什么时间。
data.enText: I lost all track of time (= forgot what time it was) .
make tracks

data.chText: 离去（尤指回家）
data.enText: to leave a place, especially to go home
on the right/wrong track

data.chText: 思路对头 / 不对头；做法对路 / 不对路
data.enText: thinking or behaving in the right/wrong way
stop/halt sb in their tracks
stop/halt/freeze in your tracks

data.chText: （使由于恐惧或吃惊）突然止步；（使）怔住
data.enText: to suddenly make sb stop by frightening or surprising them; to suddenly stop because sth has frightened or surprised you

data.chText: 这个问题问得艾丽斯张口结舌无以答对。
data.enText: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.
off the beaten track

data.chText: 远离闹市；偏远
data.enText: far away from other people, houses, etc.

data.chText: 他们住在偏远地带。
data.enText: They live miles off the beaten track.
cover your tracks

data.chText: 掩盖自己的行径
data.enText: to try and hide what you have done, because you do not want other people to find out about it

data.chText: 他使她的死亡看起来像是自杀，企图以此掩盖自己的罪行。
data.enText: He had attempted to cover his tracks by making her death appear like suicide.
hot on sb's/sth's tracks/trail

data.chText: 快要抓到，即将找到（某人或物）
data.enText: close to catching or finding the person or thing that you have been chasing or searching for
from/on the wrong side of the tracks

data.chText: 来自（城里的）贫民区；住在贫穷的地区（或城区）
data.enText: from or living in a poor area or part of town

data.chText: 跟随
data.enText: follow

data.chText: 跟踪；追踪
data.enText: to find sb/sth by following the marks, signs, information, etc., that they have left behind them

data.chText: 追踪射猎熊的猎人
data.enText: hunters tracking and shooting bears

data.chText: （尤指用特殊电子设备）跟踪，追踪
data.enText: to follow the movements of sb/sth, especially by using special electronic equipment

data.chText: 我们继续用雷达追踪那架飞机。
data.enText: We continued tracking the plane on our radar.

data.chText: 跟踪（进展情况）
data.enText: to follow the progress or development of sb/sth

data.chText: 这个研究项目对400名毕业生的事业发展情况进行跟踪调查。
data.enText: The research project involves tracking the careers of 400 graduates.

data.chText: 摄影机
data.enText: of camera

data.chText: 跟踪摄影；移动摄影
data.enText: to move in relation to the thing that is being filmed

data.chText: 摄影机最终将镜头推远。
data.enText: The camera eventually tracked away.

data.chText: 学校学生
data.enText: school students

data.chText: 留下痕迹
data.enText: leave marks

data.chText: 留下（脏）足迹
data.enText: to leave dirty marks behind you as you walk

data.chText: 别在我干净的地板上踩上泥脚印。
data.enText: Don't track mud on my clean floor.
track sb/sth↔down

data.chText: 搜寻到；跟踪找到；追查到
data.enText: to find sb/sth after searching in several different places

data.chText: 警方至今未能追捕到攻击者。
data.enText: The police have so far failed to track down the attacker.

data.chText: 在英国火车站，旅客上下火车的站台（platform）有不同的编号：
data.enText: In British stations the platforms, where passengers get on and off trains, have different numbers.

data.chText: 去爱丁堡的火车在4号站台等候。
data.enText: The Edinburgh train is waiting at platform 4.

data.chText: 在美国火车站，按火车的轨道（track）编号：
data.enText: In stations in the USA, it is the track that the train travels along that has a number.

data.chText: 去芝加哥的火车在第9道。
data.enText: The train for Chicago is on track 9.

means: (人、动物或车辆留下的)足迹，踪迹

data.chText: 离婚之后我力图使生活恢复正常。
data.enText: I tried to get my life back on track after my divorce.

data.enText: Curtis is on track for the gold medal.

data.enText: I lost all track of time (= forgot what time it was) .

data.enText: to leave a place, especially to go home

data.enText: The question stopped Alice in her tracks.

trans: 追踪到；追查到；搜寻到

tr: the act of participating in an athletic competition involving running on a track
a course over which races are run
any road or path affording passage especially a rough one
a bar or pair of parallel bars of rolled steel making the railway along which railroad cars or other vehicles can roll
a pair of parallel rails providing a runway for wheels
a groove on a phonograph recording
(computer science) one of the circular magnetic paths on a magnetic disk that serve as a guide for writing and reading data
an endless metal belt on which tracked vehicles move over the ground
evidence pointing to a possible solution
example: the police are following a promising lead
the trail led straight to the perpetrator

tr: a distinct selection of music from a recording or a compact disc
example: he played the first cut on the cd
the title track of the album

tr: a line or route along which something travels or moves
example: the hurricane demolished houses in its path
The caravan covered almost 100 miles each day

tr: go after with the intent to catch
example: The policeman chased the mugger down the alley

tr: carry on the feet and deposit
observe or plot the moving path of something

value.def: A track is a narrow road or path.

example.ex: We set off once more, over a rough mountain track.
example.tran: 我们沿着一条崎岖的山间小路再度出发。

value.def: A track is a piece of ground, often oval-shaped, that is used for races involving athletes, cars, bicycles, horses, or dogs called greyhounds.

example.ex: The two men turned to watch the horses going round the track.
example.tran: 那两个男人转身观看赛马沿赛道而行。

example.ex: ...the athletics track.
example.tran: 田径跑道

value.def: Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along.

example.ex: A woman fell on to the tracks.
example.tran: 一名女子摔倒在铁轨上。

value.def: A track is one of the songs or pieces of music on a CD, record, or tape.

example.ex: Graeme Naysmith has produced two of the ten tracks on this album.
example.tran: 格雷姆·内史密斯创作了这张专辑十首歌中的两首。

value.tran: (CD、唱片或磁带上的一首)歌曲，乐曲

value.def: Tracks are marks left in the ground by the feet of animals or people.

example.ex: The only evidence of pandas was their tracks in the snow...
example.tran: 熊猫活动的唯一迹象是它们留在雪地上的足迹。

example.ex: McKee suddenly noticed tire tracks on the bank ahead.
example.tran: 麦基突然注意到前方岸边的轮胎痕迹。

value.def: If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example the marks left by their feet.

example.ex: He thought he had better track this wolf and kill it...
example.tran: 他认为最好跟踪这只狼，杀了它。

example.ex: I followed him, tracking him in the snow until finally he got tired.
example.tran: 我跟着他，在雪地里追踪他，直到他最终体力不支。

value.def: To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar.

example.ex: Our radar began tracking the jets...
example.tran: 我们的雷达开始追踪喷气式飞机的动向。

example.ex: Forecasters are also tracking hurricane Josephine.
example.tran: 气象预报员也在追踪飓风“约瑟芬”的动向。

value.def: If you track someone or something, you investigate them, because you are interested in finding out more about them.

example.ex: If it's possible, track the rumour back to its origin...
example.tran: 如果可能，应追查谣言的源头。

example.ex: The player is being tracked by Juventus.
example.tran: 该选手正为尤文图斯队所追踪关注。

value.def: In a school, a track is a group of children of the same age and ability who are taught together.
value.tran: (同等年龄、能力的孩子组成的)班级，班组

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 stream

value.def: To track students means to divide them into groups according to their ability.

example.ex: Students are already being tracked.
example.tran: 学生已经按能力分班了。

value.tran: 把(学生)按能力分班(或组)

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 stream

example.ex: Tracking assigns some students to college prep and others to vocational programs.
example.tran: 按照能力，一些学生被分到大学预科班，另一些则被分到职业培训班。

value.def: If someone covers their tracks, they hide or destroy evidence of their identity or their actions, because they want to keep them secret.

example.ex: He covered his tracks, burnt letters and diaries...
example.tran: 他掩盖形迹，烧毁了信件与日记。

example.ex: The killer may have returned to the scene of the crime to cover his tracks.
example.tran: 凶手可能曾回到犯罪现场掩盖自己的罪行。

value.tran: 掩盖行踪;隐匿身份(或活动)

value.def: If you say that someone has the inside track, you mean that they have an advantage, for example special knowledge about something.

example.ex: Denver has the inside track among 10 sites being considered...
example.tran: 丹佛在 10 个被考虑的地点之中具有优势。

example.ex: As an agent, you may have an inside track when good deals become available.
example.tran: 作为代理人，一旦有划算的买卖你恐怕能近水楼台先得月。

value.tran: 占优势;处于有利地位;了解内情

value.def: If you keep track of a situation or a person, you make sure that you have the newest and most accurate information about them all the time.

example.ex: With eleven thousand employees, it's very difficult to keep track of them all...
example.tran: 对于一支 1.1 万人的员工队伍，很难及时了解到所有有人的动态。

example.ex: It's hard to keep track of time in here.
example.tran: 在这里很容易忘了时间。

value.tran: 跟上…的进展;掌握…的最新消息

value.def: If you lose track of someone or something, you no longer know where they are or what is happening.

example.ex: You become so deeply absorbed in an activity that you lose track of time...
example.tran: 你会因过于专注某项活动而失去时间概念。

example.ex: It's so easy to lose track of who's playing who and when.
example.tran: 很容易就忘记谁要和谁比赛，什么时候比。

value.tran: 跟不上…的进展;不再掌握…的最新情况

value.def: If you make tracks, you leave the place where you are, especially when you are in a hurry.

example.ex: We'd better make tracks soon, hadn't we?
example.tran: 我们最好马上就走，不是吗？

value.def: If someone or something is on track, they are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success.

example.ex: It may take some time to get the British economy back on track...
example.tran: 要使英国经济重新回到正轨可能需要一段时间。

example.ex: David put me back on track…
example.tran: 戴维让我重新回到了正轨。

example.ex: He believes the talks are still on track.
example.tran: 他相信会谈仍在朝正确的方向发展。

value.def: If you are on the track of someone or something, you are trying to find them, or find information about them.

example.ex: He was on the track of an escaped criminal...
example.tran: 他正在追踪一名逃犯。

example.ex: The research institute is on the track of what causes the artery damage.
example.tran: 研究所正在探究动脉损伤的诱因。

value.def: If you are on the right track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success. If you are on the wrong track, you are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in failure.

example.ex: Guests are returning in increasing numbers — a sure sign that we are on the right track...
example.tran: 回头客越来越多了——这显然表明我们的路走对了。

example.ex: We need a convincing win to put us back on the right track…
example.tran: 我们需要一场令人信服的大胜，以重回正轨。

example.ex: We thought we were on the wrong track when we heard their description of you…
example.tran: 听到他们对你的描述，我们以为自己走错了道。

example.ex: The country was headed on the wrong track, economically.
example.tran: 该国在经济上走错了路线。

value.tran: 循着正确/错误的路线;在正确/错误的道路上

value.def: If someone or something stops you in your tracks, or if you stop dead in your tracks, you suddenly stop moving because you are very surprised, impressed, or frightened.

example.ex: This magnificent church cannot fail to stop you in your tracks…
example.tran: 这座宏伟的教堂一定会让你止步赞叹。

example.ex: They stopped in their tracks and stared at him in amazement…
example.tran: 他们突然停下，惊讶地盯着他。

example.ex: The thought almost stopped me dead in my tracks.
example.tran: 这个想法几乎让我一下子停步。

value.def: If someone or something stops a process or activity in its tracks, or if it stops dead in its tracks, they prevent the process or activity from continuing.

example.ex: Francis felt he would like to stop this conversation in its tracks…
example.tran: 弗朗西斯觉得他应该立即打断这一谈话。

example.ex: U.S. manufacturers may find the export boom stopping dead in its tracks.
example.tran: 美国制造商将会发现出口热戛然而止。

trans: 田径；田径运动
在正确的轨道上
通晓事态，注意动向
跟上…的进展;掌握…的最新消息
(个人或组织的)业绩记录
在轨道上；在路上；未离题；田径场上
用轨道
追踪到；追查到；搜寻到
循着正确/错误的路线;在正确/错误的道路上
回到正轨；重回轨道；重回正轨；重上轨道
快速通道；快速晋升之道；迅速成功之路
加速（人；计划）的发展；促进
双线；双轨；双声道，双声轨（录音磁带）
铁路线路；铁路轨道
声道;电影声带;(尤指)电影配乐
追踪;追查;探究
赛马跑道;赛马场；赛车场；赛道
可靠的工作业绩
轨道电路；軌道電路；轨道电路装置
跟踪系统；轨道系统；道轨系统；轨道的选择
熟路；踏平的路，惯例
